metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11984 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Apache HTTP server 2.4.32 to 2.4.44 mod_proxy_uwsgi info disclosure and possible RCE

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11984` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi binary package is in universe mdeslaur> the libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi module moved from the uwsgi source package to the apache2 source package in focal+

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.1').
